meanings.definition: The world or realm of dogs.
meanings.sent1: In dogdom, canines rule the land with wagging tails and wet noses.
meanings.sent2: My neighbor's backyard is a bustling dogdom, filled with playful pups of all sizes.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel thought he could conquer dogdom with his acrobatic skills, but the dogs just barked him away.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the park transformed into a magical dogdom where every tree seemed to whisper secrets to the canines.
meanings.sent5: Exploring the vast dogdom of the internet, I found countless adorable dog videos to watch.

meanings.definition: The collective group or community of dogs.
meanings.sent1: Dogdom gathered at the park for a friendly playdate, tails wagging in excitement.
meanings.sent2: The local dog shelter works tirelessly to find loving homes for every member of dogdom.
meanings.sent3: When the doorbell rang, the whole neighborhood echoed with the chorus of dogdom's protective barks.
meanings.sent4: In the world of dogdom, loyalty and companionship are valued above all else.
meanings.sent5: The annual dog show brought together the finest representatives of dogdom, showcasing their unique talents and personalities.
